item.title: The Commission's Proposal on gender quotas in corporate boards suggests a 40% representation of Venus and 60% representation of Mars.
item.description: Juan Carlos Benito Sánchez, LL.M. Candidate at KU Leuven — Twitter @jcbensan The European Union faces a significant gender diversity challenge in its top corporate leadership positions. Although more than half of European university graduates are women, they remain underrepresented on company boards. Men outnumber women nearly four to one in these positions, with significant disparities among member states, ranging from under five percent female representation to over thirty percent.
